intro: Brayopsis hauthalii, commonly known as the Hauthal’s brayopsis, is a rare and unique species of aquatic plant. It is native to the freshwater habitats of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branching structure and small, spirally arranged leaves. It thrives in still or slow-moving waters with sandy or muddy substrates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
